Events that occurred on 2 December.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 - J.R.R. Tolkien attends a military medical board examination, and is sent to Great Haywood to recuperate.
1933 - Father Christmas writes a letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
1945 - J.R.R. Tolkien submits The Homecoming of Beorhtnoth Beorhthelm's Son for publication.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 142.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 158.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien finishes writing a letter to Rayner Heppenstall.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Elizabeth Jennings.
1956 - The third episode of 1956 radio series of The Lord of the Rings airs on the BBC Third Programme.
1989 - Norman Davis dies.
2021 - Antony Sher dies.

content.content:
